usefulItems: casserole dish, wooden skewer, baking paper, rectangular cake tin, oven
title: Chocolate 'feed a crowd' cake

ingredients.content: 400 g water, plus extra for steaming
80 g oil, plus extra for greasing

preparations.content: Place a casserole dish filled three-quarters full with water onto bottom shelf in oven. Preheat oven to 180°C. Grease and line a rectangular cake tin (approx. 22 x 30 cm) with baking paper and set aside.
Place oil, water, vanilla, vinegar, bicarbonate of soda, sugar, flour, cocoa powder and salt into mixing bowl and mix <b>30 sec/speed 5<b>.
Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and mix <b>10 sec/speed 6<b>.

Pour mixture into prepared tin and place on the shelf above casserole dish with water and bake for 40-45 minutes (180°C) or until a wooden skewer inserted into the centre of the cake comes out clean. Allow to cool, then decorate as desired to serve.

hintsAndTricks: We decorated our cake simply with fruit and cream. But you can use buttercream icing, sprinkles, ganache, etc. It's the perfect blank canvas for any creation!
This cake freezes well cut into individual portions, making them ideal for lunchboxes or picnics.
